result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus E. Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus E. Grant is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus E. Grant was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 34 days, if revoked.
Court will not permit the firearm to be returned & orders the firearm be destroyed.  Owner of the firearm present in court & does not object.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge - each count.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus E. Grant

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter (in 14CF436 & 14CF870).  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:36am-  Matter heard with 14CF870 & 14CF1423.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 30 months w/conditions - concurrent to 14CF870.  34 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  Court will not permit the firearm to be returned & orders the firearm be destroyed.  Owner of the firearm present in court & does not object.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter (in 14CF436 & 14CF870).  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:23pm-  Matter heard with 14CF870 & 14CF1423.  For reasons set forth on the record, Court will not proceed today & adjourns sentencing hearing to January 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
